This is designed\n     * to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that\n     * this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function\n     * uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.\n     */\n    function values(Bytes32Set storage set) internal view returns (bytes32[] memory) {\n        bytes32[] memory store = _values(set._inner);\n        bytes32[] memory result;\n\n        /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly\n        assembly {\n            result := store\n        }\n\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    // AddressSet\n\n    struct AddressSet {\n        Set _inner;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Add a value to a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was added to the set, that is if it was not\n     * already present.\n     */\n    function add(AddressSet storage set, address value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _add(set._inner, bytes32(uint256(uint160(value))));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Removes a value from a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was removed from the set, that is if it was\n     * present.\n     */\n    function remove(AddressSet storage set, address value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _remove(set._inner, bytes32(uint256(uint160(value))));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns true if the value is in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function contains(AddressSet storage set, address value) internal view returns (bool) {\n        return _contains(set._inner, bytes32(uint256(uint160(value))));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the number of values in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function length(AddressSet storage set) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return _length(set._inner);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the value stored at position `index` in the set. This is designed\n     * to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that\n     * this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function\n     * uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.\n     */\n    function values(AddressSet storage set) internal view returns (address[] memory) {\n        bytes32[] memory store = _values(set._inner);\n        address[] memory result;\n\n        /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly\n        assembly {\n            result := store\n        }\n\n        return result;\n    }\n\n    // UintSet\n\n    struct UintSet {\n        Set _inner;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Add a value to a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was added to the set, that is if it was not\n     * already present.\n     */\n    function add(UintSet storage set, uint256 value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _add(set._inner, bytes32(value));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Removes a value from a set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Returns true if the value was removed from the set, that is if it was\n     * present.\n     */\n    function remove(UintSet storage set, uint256 value) internal returns (bool) {\n        return _remove(set._inner, bytes32(value));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns true if the value is in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function contains(UintSet storage set, uint256 value) internal view returns (bool) {\n        return _contains(set._inner, bytes32(value));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the number of values in the set. O(1).\n     */\n    function length(UintSet storage set) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return _length(set._inner);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Returns the value stored at position `index` in the set. O(1).\n     *\n     * Note that there are no guarantees on the ordering of values inside the\n     * array, and it may change when more values are added or removed.\n     *\n     * Requirements:\n     *\n     * - `index` must be strictly less than {length}.\n     */\n    function at(UintSet storage set, uint256 index) internal view returns (uint256) {\n        return uint256(_at(set._inner, index));\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Return the entire set in an array\n     *\n     * WARNING: This operation will copy the entire storage to memory, which can be quite expensive. This is designed\n     * to mostly be used by view accessors that are queried without any gas fees. Developers should keep in mind that\n     * this function has an unbounded cost, and using it as part of a state-changing function may render the function\n     * uncallable if the set grows to a point where copying to memory consumes too much gas to fit in a block.\n     */\n    function values(UintSet storage set) internal view returns (uint256[] memory) {\n        bytes32[] memory store = _values(set._inner);\n        uint256[] memory result;\n\n        /// @solidity memory-safe-assembly\n        assembly {\n            result := store\n        }\n\n        return result;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0x4807db844a856813048b5af81a764fdd25a0ae8876a3132593e8d21ddc6b607c","license":"MIT"},"contracts/CustomProposal.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity 0.8.17;\n\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/OwnableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/Initializable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/proxy/utils/UUPSUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/token/ERC20/IERC20Upgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/utils/math/MathUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/access/AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/IPool.sol\";\n\nimport \"./interfaces/governor/IGovernanceSettings.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/governor/IGovernor.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/IService.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/registry/IRecordsRegistry.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/registry/IRegistry.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/ITGE.sol\";\nimport \"./interfaces/IToken.sol\";\nimport \"./libraries/ExceptionsLibrary.sol\";\n\n/**\n * @title Custom Proposal Contract\n * @notice This contract is designed for constructing proposals from user input. The methods generate calldata from the input arguments and pass it to the specified pool as a proposal.\n * @dev It is a supporting part of the protocol that takes user input arguments and constructs OZ Governor-compatible structures describing the transactions to be executed upon successful voting on the proposal. It does not store user input, but only passes it on in a transformed format to the specified pool contract.\n */\ncontract CustomProposal is Initializable, AccessControlEnumerableUpgradeable {\n    // STORAGE\n\n    /// @dev The address of the Service contract.\n    IService public service;\n\n    // MODIFIERS\n\n    /// @notice Modifier that makes the function callable only by the Service contract.\n    /// @dev Allows the function to be executed only if the address sending the transaction is equal to the address of the Service contract stored in the memory of this contract.\n    modifier onlyService() {\n        require(msg.sender == address(service), ExceptionsLibrary.NOT_SERVICE);\n        _;\n    }\n\n    /// @notice Modifier that checks the existence of a pool at the given address.\n    /// @dev Checks the existence of the pool for which the proposal is being constructed. The pool should store the same Service contract address as stored in the Custom Proposal contract and be registered in the Registry contract with the corresponding type.\n    modifier onlyForPool(address pool) {\n        //check if pool registry record exists\n        require(\n            service.registry().typeOf(pool) ==\n                IRecordsRegistry.ContractType.Pool,\n            ExceptionsLibrary.NOT_POOL\n        );\n        _;\n    }\n\n    // INITIALIZER\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Contract constructor.\n     * @dev This contract uses OpenZeppelin upgrades and has no need for a constructor function.\n     * The constructor is replaced with an initializer function.\n     * This method disables the initializer feature of the OpenZeppelin upgrades plugin, preventing the initializer methods from being misused.\n     * @custom:oz-upgrades-unsafe-allow constructor\n     */\n    constructor() {\n        _disableInitializers();\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Contract initializer\n     * @dev This method replaces the constructor for upgradeable contracts.\n     */\n    function initialize() public initializer {\n        _grantRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE, msg.sender);\n    }\n\n    // PUBLIC FUNCTIONS\n\n    /**\n     * @dev Stores a new address of the Service contract in the memory of this contract.\n     * @param service_ The new address of the Service contract.\n     */\n    function setService(\n        address service_\n    ) external onlyRole(DEFAULT_ADMIN_ROLE) {\n        service = IService(service_);\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This proposal is the only way to withdraw funds from the pool account.\n     * @dev This function prepares a proposal from the list of recipients and corresponding amounts and submits it to the pool for a vote to transfer those amounts to the specified recipients. The asset type is specified as a separate argument, which is the same for all recipients.\n     * @param pool The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched and from whose balance the values will be transferred.\n     * @param asset Asset to transfer (address(0) for ETH transfers).\n     * @param recipients Transfer recipients.\n     * @param amounts Transfer amounts.\n     * @param description Proposal description.\n     * @param metaHash Hash value of proposal metadata.\n     * @return proposalId The ID of the created proposal.\n     */\n    function proposeTransfer(\n        address pool,\n        address asset,\n        address[] memory recipients,\n        uint256[] memory amounts,\n        string memory description,\n        string memory metaHash\n    ) external returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        // Check lengths\n\n        require(\n            recipients.length > 0 && recipients.length == amounts.length,\n            ExceptionsLibrary.INVALID_VALUE\n        );\n\n        // Prepare proposal actions\n        address[] memory targets = new address[](recipients.length);\n        uint256[] memory values = new uint256[](recipients.length);\n        bytes[] memory callDatas = new bytes[](recipients.length);\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < recipients.length; i++) {\n            if (asset == address(0)) {\n                targets[i] = recipients[i];\n                callDatas[i] = \"\";\n                values[i] = amounts[i];\n            } else {\n                targets[i] = asset;\n                callDatas[i] = abi.encodeWithSelector(\n                    IERC20Upgradeable.transfer.selector,\n                    recipients[i],\n                    amounts[i]\n                );\n                values[i] = 0;\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Create proposal\n\n        uint256 proposalId_ = IPool(pool).propose(\n            msg.sender,\n            0,\n            IGovernor.ProposalCoreData({\n                targets: targets,\n                values: values,\n                callDatas: callDatas,\n                quorumThreshold: 0,\n                decisionThreshold: 0,\n                executionDelay: 0\n            }),\n            IGovernor.ProposalMetaData({\n                proposalType: IRecordsRegistry.EventType.Transfer,\n                description: description,\n                metaHash: metaHash\n            })\n        );\n        return proposalId_;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This proposal is launched when there is a need to issue additional tokens (both Governance and Preference) for an existing pool. In other words, the issuance of tokens for any DAO is possible only through the creation of such a proposal.\n     * @dev Proposal to launch a new token generation event (TGE). It can only be created if the maximum supply threshold value for an existing token has not been reached or if a new token is being created, in which case a new token contract will be deployed simultaneously with the TGE contract.\n     * @param pool The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched and for which the TGE event will be launched.\n     * @param tgeInfo TGE parameters.\n     * @param tokenInfo Token parameters.\n     * @param metadataURI TGE metadata URI.\n     * @param description Proposal description.\n     * @param metaHash Hash value of proposal metadata.\n     * @return proposalId The ID of the created proposal.\n     */\n    function proposeTGE(\n        address pool,\n        address token,\n        ITGE.TGEInfo memory tgeInfo,\n        IToken.TokenInfo memory tokenInfo,\n        string memory metadataURI,\n        string memory description,\n        string memory metaHash\n    ) external returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        // Get cap and supply data\n        uint256 totalSupplyWithReserves = 0;\n\n        //Check if token is new or exists for pool\n        require(\n            address(token) == address(0) ||\n                IPool(pool).tokenExists(IToken(token)),\n            ExceptionsLibrary.WRONG_TOKEN_ADDRESS\n        );\n\n        if (tokenInfo.tokenType == IToken.TokenType.Governance) {\n            tokenInfo.cap = IToken(token).cap();\n            totalSupplyWithReserves = IToken(token).totalSupplyWithReserves();\n        } else if (tokenInfo.tokenType == IToken.TokenType.Preference) {\n            if (token != address(0)) {\n                if (IToken(token).isPrimaryTGESuccessful()) {\n                    tokenInfo.cap = IToken(token).cap();\n                    totalSupplyWithReserves = IToken(token)\n                        .totalSupplyWithReserves();\n                }\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Validate TGE info\n        IService(service).validateTGEInfo(\n            tgeInfo,\n            tokenInfo.cap,\n            totalSupplyWithReserves,\n            tokenInfo.tokenType\n        );\n\n        // Prepare proposal action\n        address[] memory targets = new address[](1);\n        targets[0] = address(IService(service).tgeFactory());\n\n        uint256[] memory values = new uint256[](1);\n        values[0] = 0;\n\n        bytes[] memory callDatas = new bytes[](1);\n        callDatas[0] = abi.encodeWithSelector(\n            ITGEFactory.createSecondaryTGE.selector,\n            token,\n            tgeInfo,\n            tokenInfo,\n            metadataURI\n        );\n\n        // Propose\n        uint256 proposalId_ = IPool(pool).propose(\n            msg.sender,\n            1,\n            IGovernor.ProposalCoreData({\n                targets: targets,\n                values: values,\n                callDatas: callDatas,\n                quorumThreshold: 0,\n                decisionThreshold: 0,\n                executionDelay: 0\n            }),\n            IGovernor.ProposalMetaData({\n                proposalType: IRecordsRegistry.EventType.TGE,\n                description: description,\n                metaHash: metaHash\n            })\n        );\n\n        return proposalId_;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Proposal to replace Governance settings. One of the two methods to change voting parameters.\n     * @dev The main parameter should be a structure of type NewGovernanceSettings, which includes the Governance Threshold, Decision Threshold, Proposal Threshold, and execution delay lists for proposals.\n     * @param pool The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched and for which the Governance settings will be changed.\n     * @param settings New governance settings.\n     * @param description Proposal description.\n     * @param metaHash Hash value of proposal metadata.\n     * @return proposalId The ID of the created proposal.\n     */\n    function proposeGovernanceSettings(\n        address pool,\n        IGovernanceSettings.NewGovernanceSettings memory settings,\n        string memory description,\n        string memory metaHash\n    ) external returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        //Check if last GovernanceSettings proposal is not Active\n\n        require(\n            !IPool(pool).isLastProposalIdByTypeActive(2),\n            ExceptionsLibrary.ACTIVE_GOVERNANCE_SETTINGS_PROPOSAL_EXISTS\n        );\n\n        // Validate settings\n        IPool(pool).validateGovernanceSettings(settings);\n\n        // Prepare proposal action\n        address[] memory targets = new address[](1);\n        targets[0] = pool;\n\n        uint256[] memory values = new uint256[](1);\n        values[0] = 0;\n\n        bytes[] memory callDatas = new bytes[](1);\n        callDatas[0] = abi.encodeWithSelector(\n            IGovernanceSettings.setGovernanceSettings.selector,\n            settings\n        );\n\n        // Propose\n        uint256 proposalId_ = IPool(pool).propose(\n            msg.sender,\n            2,\n            IGovernor.ProposalCoreData({\n                targets: targets,\n                values: values,\n                callDatas: callDatas,\n                quorumThreshold: 0,\n                decisionThreshold: 0,\n                executionDelay: 0\n            }),\n            IGovernor.ProposalMetaData({\n                proposalType: IRecordsRegistry.EventType.GovernanceSettings,\n                description: description,\n                metaHash: metaHash\n            })\n        );\n\n        return proposalId_;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Creating a custom proposal.\n     * @dev This tool can be useful for creating a transaction with arbitrary parameters and putting it to a vote for execution on behalf of the pool.\n     * @param pool The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched.\n     * @param targets Transfer recipients.\n     * @param values Transfer amounts for payable.\n     * @param callDatas Raw calldatas.\n     * @param description Proposal description.\n     * @param metaHash Hash value of proposal metadata.\n     * @return proposalId The ID of the created proposal.\n     */\n    function proposeCustomTx(\n        address pool,\n        address[] memory targets,\n        uint256[] memory values,\n        bytes[] memory callDatas,\n        string memory description,\n        string memory metaHash\n    ) external onlyForPool(pool) returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        // Check lengths\n        require(\n            targets.length == values.length &&\n                targets.length == callDatas.length,\n            ExceptionsLibrary.INVALID_VALUE\n        );\n\n        for (uint256 i = 0; i < targets.length; i++) {\n            require(\n                IRegistry(IService(service).registry()).typeOf(targets[i]) ==\n                    IRecordsRegistry.ContractType.None,\n                ExceptionsLibrary.INVALID_TARGET\n            );\n        }\n\n        // Create proposal\n\n        uint256 proposalId_ = IPool(pool).propose(\n            msg.sender,\n            4, // - CustomTx Type\n            IGovernor.ProposalCoreData({\n                targets: targets,\n                values: values,\n                callDatas: callDatas,\n                quorumThreshold: 0,\n                decisionThreshold: 0,\n                executionDelay: 0\n            }),\n            IGovernor.ProposalMetaData({\n                proposalType: IRecordsRegistry.EventType.Transfer,\n                description: description,\n                metaHash: metaHash\n            })\n        );\n        return proposalId_;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This proposal is launched when there is a need to issue ERC1155 Preference tokens, additional collections, and token units in existing collections for an existing ERC1155 token. In other words, the issuance of tokens of this format for any DAO is possible only through the creation of such a proposal.\n     * @dev Proposal to launch a new token generation event (TGE) for ERC1155 preference tokens.\n     * @param tgeInfo TGE parameters.\n     * @param tokenId Token ID.\n     * @param tokenIdMetadataURI Token ID metadata URI.\n     * @param tokenInfo Token parameters.\n     * @param metadataURI TGE metadata URI.\n     * @param description Proposal description.\n     * @param metaHash Hash value of proposal metadata.\n     * @return proposalId The ID of the created proposal.\n     */\n    function proposeTGEERC1155(\n        address pool,\n        address token,\n        uint256 tokenId,\n        string memory tokenIdMetadataURI,\n        ITGE.TGEInfo memory tgeInfo,\n        IToken.TokenInfo memory tokenInfo,\n        string memory metadataURI,\n        string memory description,\n        string memory metaHash\n    ) external returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        // Get cap and supply data\n        uint256 totalSupplyWithReserves = 0;\n\n        //Check if token is new or exists for pool\n        require(\n            address(token) == address(0) ||\n                IPool(pool).tokenExists(IToken(token)),\n            ExceptionsLibrary.WRONG_TOKEN_ADDRESS\n        );\n        \n            require(\n                    address(token) == address(0) ||\n                    ITokenERC1155(token).cap(tokenId)==0 ||\n                    ITGE(ITokenERC1155(token).lastTGE(tokenId)).state() !=\n                    ITGE.State.Active,\n                ExceptionsLibrary.ACTIVE_TGE_EXISTS\n            );\n        \n        if (token != address(0)) {\n            if (tokenId!=0 && ITokenERC1155(token).isPrimaryTGESuccessful(tokenId)) {\n                tokenInfo.cap = ITokenERC1155(token).cap(tokenId);\n                totalSupplyWithReserves = ITokenERC1155(token)\n                    .totalSupplyWithReserves(tokenId);\n            }\n        }\n\n        // Validate TGE info\n        IService(service).validateTGEInfo(\n            tgeInfo,\n            tokenInfo.cap,\n            totalSupplyWithReserves,\n            tokenInfo.tokenType\n        );\n\n        // Prepare proposal action\n        address[] memory targets = new address[](1);\n        targets[0] = address(IService(service).tgeFactory());\n\n        uint256[] memory values = new uint256[](1);\n        values[0] = 0;\n\n        bytes[] memory callDatas = new bytes[](1);\n        callDatas[0] = abi.encodeWithSelector(\n            ITGEFactory.createSecondaryTGEERC1155.selector,\n            token,\n            tokenId,\n            tokenIdMetadataURI,\n            tgeInfo,\n            tokenInfo,\n            metadataURI\n        );\n\n        // Propose\n        uint256 proposalId_ = IPool(pool).propose(\n            msg.sender,\n            6,\n            IGovernor.ProposalCoreData({\n                targets: targets,\n                values: values,\n                callDatas: callDatas,\n                quorumThreshold: 0,\n                decisionThreshold: 0,\n                executionDelay: 0\n            }),\n            IGovernor.ProposalMetaData({\n                proposalType: IRecordsRegistry.EventType.TGE,\n                description: description,\n                metaHash: metaHash\n            })\n        );\n\n        return proposalId_;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Proposal to replace Governance settings and change the pool's list of secretaries and executors. One of the two methods to change voting parameters. The only way for a DAO to modify the lists of secretaries and executors.\n     * @dev The main parameter should be a structure of type NewGovernanceSettings, which includes the Governance Threshold, Decision Threshold, Proposal Threshold, execution delay lists for proposals, as well as two sets of addresses: one for the new list of secretaries and another for the new list of executors.\n     * @param pool The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched and for which the Governance settings will be changed.\n     * @param settings New governance settings.\n     * @param secretary Add a new address to the pool's secretary list.\n     * @param executor Add a new address to the pool's executor list.\n     * @param description Proposal description.\n     * @param metaHash Hash value of the proposal metadata.\n     * @return proposalId The ID of the created proposal.\n     */\n    function proposeGovernanceSettingsWithRoles(\n        address pool,\n        IGovernanceSettings.NewGovernanceSettings memory settings,\n        address[] memory secretary,\n        address[] memory executor,\n        string memory description,\n        string memory metaHash\n    ) external returns (uint256 proposalId) {\n        //Check if last GovernanceSettings proposal is not Active\n\n        require(\n            !IPool(pool).isLastProposalIdByTypeActive(2),\n            ExceptionsLibrary.ACTIVE_GOVERNANCE_SETTINGS_PROPOSAL_EXISTS\n        );\n\n        // Validate settings\n        IPool(pool).validateGovernanceSettings(settings);\n\n        // Prepare proposal action\n        address[] memory targets = new address[](1);\n        targets[0] = pool;\n\n        uint256[] memory values = new uint256[](1);\n        values[0] = 0;\n\n        bytes[] memory callDatas = new bytes[](1);\n        callDatas[0] = abi.encodeWithSelector(\n            IPool.setSettings.selector,\n            settings,\n            secretary,\n            executor\n        );\n\n        // Propose\n        uint256 proposalId_ = IPool(pool).propose(\n            msg.sender,\n            2,\n            IGovernor.ProposalCoreData({\n                targets: targets,\n                values: values,\n                callDatas: callDatas,\n                quorumThreshold: 0,\n                decisionThreshold: 0,\n                executionDelay: 0\n            }),\n            IGovernor.ProposalMetaData({\n                proposalType: IRecordsRegistry.EventType.GovernanceSettings,\n                description: description,\n                metaHash: metaHash\n            })\n        );\n\n        return proposalId_;\n    }\n}\n","keccak256":"0xe0f4105fe65289e23522bf0d39af6040da30a85c023cffe26d2c4f1659b324d2","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/ICustomProposal.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity 0.8.17;\n\nimport \"./ITGE.sol\";\n\nimport \"./governor/IGovernanceSettings.sol\";\n\ninterface ICustomProposal {}\n","keccak256":"0x8fe04afb34d557d6cec7fec360eec6609b879fb16fe6220d3654ebf972611bf3","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/IInvoice.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity 0.8.17;\n/**\n * @title Invoice Interface\n * @notice These structures are used to describe an instance of an invoice.\n * @dev The storage of invoices is managed in Invoice.sol in the `invoices` variable.\n*/\ninterface IInvoice {\n    /** \n    * @notice This interface contains a data structure that describes the payment rules for an invoice. \n    * @dev This data is used to validate the payment transaction, determine the state of the invoice, and so on. This data is formed from the input of the invoice creator.\n    * @param amount Amount to be paid\n    * @param unitOfAccount The address of the token contract that can be used to make the payment (a zero address assumes payment in native ETH)\n    * @param expirationBlock The block at which the invoice expires\n    * @param description Description of the invoice\n    * @param whitelist A whitelist of payers. An empty array denotes a public invoice.\n    */\n    struct InvoiceCore {\n        uint256 amount;\n        address unitOfAccount;\n        uint256 expirationBlock;\n        string description;\n        address[] whitelist;\n    }\n    /**\n    * @notice This interface is used to store complete records of invoices, including their current state, metadata, and payment rules.\n    * @dev This data is automatically formed when the invoice is created and changes when state-changing transactions are executed.\n    * @param core Payment rules (user input)\n    * @param invoiceId Invoice identifier\n    * @param createdBy The creator of the invoice\n    * @param isPaid Flag indicating whether the invoice has been successfully paid\n    * @param isCanceled Flag indicating whether the invoice has been canceled\n    */\n    struct InvoiceInfo {\n        InvoiceCore core;\n        uint256 invoiceId;\n        address createdBy;\n        bool isPaid;\n        bool isCanceled;\n    }\n    /**\n    * @notice Encoding the states of an individual invoice\n    * @dev None - for a non-existent invoice, Paid, Expired, Canceled - are completed invoice states where payment is not possible.\n    */\n    enum InvoiceState {\n        None,\n        Active,\n        Paid,\n        Expired,\n        Canceled\n    }\n\n    function createInvoice(address pool, InvoiceCore memory core) external;\n\n    function payInvoice(address pool, uint256 invoiceId) external payable;\n\n    function cancelInvoice(address pool, uint256 invoiceId) external;\n\n    function setInvoiceCanceled(address pool, uint256 invoiceId) solidity 0.8.17;\n\nimport \"./IToken.sol\";\nimport \"./ITokenERC1155.sol\";\nimport \"./IVesting.sol\";\n\ninterface ITGE {\n    /**\n    * @notice This structure defines comprehensive TGE settings, including Vesting, Lockup, and distribution rules for these tokens.\n    * @dev Initially, such a structure appears as a parameter when creating a proposal in CustomProposal, after which the data from the structure is placed in the storage of the deployed TGE contract.\n    * @dev In addition, these data are used as an argument in its original form in the TGEFactory contract, including when creating the initial TGE by the pool owner without a proposal.\n    * @param price The price of one token in the smallest unitOfAccount (1 wei when defining the price in ETH, 0.000001 USDT when defining the price in USDT, etc.)\n    * @param hardcap The maximum number of tokens that can be sold (note the ProtocolTokenFee for Governance Tokens)\n    * @param softcap The minimum number of tokens that buyers must acquire for the TGE to be considered successful\n    * @param minPurchase The minimum number of tokens that can be purchased by a single account (minimum one-time purchase)\n    * @param maxPurchase The maximum number of tokens that can be purchased by a single account in total during the launched TGE \n    * @param duration The duration of the event in blocks, after which the TGE status will be forcibly changed from Active to another\n    * @param vestingParams Vesting settings for tokens acquired during this TGE\n    * @param userWhiteList A list of addresses allowed to participate in this TGE. Leave the list empty to make the TGE public.\n    * @param unitOfAccount The address of the ERC20 or compatible token contract, in the smallest units of which the price of one token is determined\n    * @param lockupDuration The duration of token lockup (in blocks), one of two independent lockup conditions.\n    * @param lockupTVL The minimum total pool balance in USD, one of two independent lockup conditions.\n    */\n\n    struct TGEInfo {\n        uint256 price;\n        uint256 hardcap;\n        uint256 softcap;\n        uint256 minPurchase;\n        uint256 maxPurchase;\n        uint256 duration;\n        IVesting.VestingParams vestingParams;\n        address[] userWhitelist;\n        address unitOfAccount;\n        uint256 lockupDuration;\n        uint256 lockupTVL;\n    }\n\n    function initialize(\n        address _service,\n        address _token,\n        uint256 _tokenId,\n        string memory _uri,\n        TGEInfo calldata _info,\n        uint256 _protocolFee\n    ) external;\n\n    enum State {\n        Active,\n        Failed,\n        Successful\n    }\n\n    function token() external view returns (address);\n\n    function tokenId() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function state() external view returns (State);\n\n    function getInfo() external view returns (TGEInfo memory);\n\n    function transferUnlocked() external view returns (bool);\n\n    function purchaseOf(address user) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function redeemableBalanceOf(address user) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function lockedBalanceOf(address account) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function getEnd() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function totalPurchased() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function isERC1155TGE() external view returns (bool);\n\n    function purchase(uint256 amount) external payable;\n\n    function transferFunds() external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x447391e73867bcc6a75ae5221b0e5aff0c46cc143de0c6df316cacb9dd54ef97","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/ITGEFactory.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: \"@openzeppelin/contracts-upgradeable/governance/utils/IVotesUpgradeable.sol\";\nimport \"./IService.sol\";\n\ninterface IToken is IVotesUpgradeable, IERC20Upgradeable {\n    /**\n    * @notice This structure is used to define the parameters of ERC20 tokens issued by the protocol for pools.\n    * @dev This structure is suitable for both Governance and Preference tokens if they are based on ERC20.\n    * @param tokenType Numeric code for the token type\n    * @param name Full name of the token\n    * @param symbol Ticker symbol (short name) of the token\n    * @param description    function lastTGE() external view returns (address);\n\n    function getTGEList() external view returns (address[] memory);\n\n    function isPrimaryTGESuccessful() external view returns (bool);\n\n    function addTGE(address tge) external;\n\n    function setTGEVestedTokens(uint256 amount) external;\n\n    function setProtocolFeeReserved(uint256 amount) external;\n\n    function getTotalTGEVestedTokens() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function getTotalProtocolFeeReserved() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function totalSupplyWithReserves() external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function transferFrom(\n        address from,\n        address to,\n        uint256 amount\n    ) external returns (bool);\n\n    function transfer(address to, uint256 amount) external returns (bool);\n\n    function delegate(\n        address delegatee\n    ) external; \n}\n","keccak256":"0x0612419b2fb3211601fe3a7619e318b44fc70929cd278d4b1de9fb97fafe849d","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/ITokenERC1155.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma ) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function totalSupplyWithReserves(\n        uint256 tokenId\n    ) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function setURI(uint256 tokenId, string memory uint256 amount\n    ) external;\n\n    function setLastTokenId(uint256 tokenId) MIT\n\npragma solidity 0.8.17;\n\ninterface IVesting {\n    /**\n     * @notice This interface describes a vesting program for tokens distributed within a specific TGE.\n     * @dev Such data is stored in the TGE contracts in the TGEInfo public info.\n     * @param vestedShare The percentage of tokens that participate in the vesting program (not distributed until conditions are met)\n     * @param cliff Cliff period (in blocks)\n     * @param cliffShare The portion of tokens that are distributed\n     * @param spans The number of periods for distributing the remaining tokens in vesting in equal shares\n     * @param spanDuration The duration of one such period (in blocks)\n     * @param spanShare The percentage of the total number of tokens in vesting that corresponds to one such period\n     * @param claimTVL The minimum required TVL of the pool after which it will be possible to claim tokens from vesting. Optional parameter (0 if this condition is not needed)\n     * @param resolvers A list of addresses that can cancel the vesting program for any address from the TGE participants list\n     */\n    struct VestingParams {\n        uint256 vestedShare;\n        uint256 cliff;\n        uint256 cliffShare;\n        uint256 spans;\n        uint256 spanDuration;\n        uint256 spanShare;\n        uint256 claimTVL;\n        address[] resolvers;\n    }\n\n    function vest(address to, uint256 amount) external;\n\n    function cancel(address tge, address account) external;\n\n    function validateParams(\n        VestingParams memory params\n    ) external pure returns (bool);\n\n    function vested(\n        address tge,\n        address account\n    ) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function totalVested(address tge) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function vestedBalanceOf(\n        address tge,\n        address account\n    ) external view returns (uint256);\n\n    function claim(address tge) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x0010734d17d97f6915b54d427dd8237ac00c26702d4719510f60f4f62faaf5ad","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/governor/IGovernanceSettings.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity 0.8.17;\n\ninterface IGovernanceSettings {\n    /**\n     * @notice This structure specifies and stores the Governance settings for each individual pool.\n     * @dev More information on the thresholds (proposal, quorum, decision) and creating proposals can be found in the \"Other Entities\" section.\n     * @param proposalThreshold_ The proposal threshold (specified in token units with decimals taken into account)\n     * @param quorumThreshold_ The quorum threshold (specified as a percentage)\n     * @param decisionThreshold_ The decision threshold (specified as a percentage)\n     * @param votingDuration_ The duration of the voting period (specified in blocks)\n     * @param transferValueForDelay_ The minimum amount in USD for which a transfer from the pool wallet will be subject to a del\n     * @param executionDelays_ List of execution delays specified in blocks for different types of proposals\n     * @param votingStartDelay The delay before voting starts for newly created proposals, specified in blocks\n     */\n    struct NewGovernanceSettings {\n        uint256 proposalThreshold;\n        uint256 quorumThreshold;\n        uint256 decisionThreshold;\n        uint256 votingDuration;\n        uint256 transferValueForDelay;\n        uint256[4] executionDelays;\n        uint256 votingStartDelay;\n    }\n\n    function setGovernanceSettings(\n        NewGovernanceSettings memory settings\n    ) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x57a44602b869bd2123d09f10cc7269454ad3637e92bda79f8e117dace0a21c31","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/governor/IGovernor.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity 0.8.17;\n\nimport \"../../interfaces/registry/IRecordsRegistry.sol\";\n\ninterface IGovernor {\n    /**\n     * @notice Struct with proposal core data\n     * @dev This interface specifies the Governance settings that existed in the pool at the time of proposal creation, as well as the service data (to which addresses and with what messages and amounts of ETH should be sent) of the scenario that should be executed in case of a positive voting outcome.\n     * @param targets A list of addresses to be called in case of a positive voting outcome\n     * @param values The amounts of wei to be sent to the addresses from targets\n     * @param callDatas The 'calldata' messages to be attached to transactions\n     * @param quorumThreshold The quorum, expressed as a percentage with DENOM taken into account\n     * @param decisionThreshold The decision-making threshold, expressed as a percentage with DENOM taken into account\n     * @param executionDelay The number of blocks that must pass since the creation of the proposal for it to be considered launched\n     */\n    struct ProposalCoreData {\n        address[] targets;\n        uint256[] values;\n        bytes[] callDatas;\n        uint256 quorumThreshold;\n        uint256 decisionThreshold;\n        uint256 executionDelay;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This interface specifies information about the subject of the voting, intended for human perception.\n     * @dev Struct with proposal metadata\n     * @param proposalType The digital code of the proposal type\n     * @param description The public description of the proposal\n     * @param metaHash The identifier of the private proposal description stored on the backend\n     */\n    struct ProposalMetaData {\n        IRecordsRegistry.EventType proposalType;\n        string description;\n        string metaHash;\n    }\n\n    function proposalState(uint256 proposalId)\n        external\n        view\n        returns (uint256 state);\n}\n","keccak256":"0x0f5b0524854bb46e130f27edeafdd5d06e5e203a970f0db2b16175b22fb8838a","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/governor/IGovernorProposals.sol":{"content":"// (IService);\n}\n","keccak256":"0xccb34e00bebdc99b089351a10727d57141e22268ef25b289e7d3aba34177f9c7","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/registry/ICompaniesRegistry.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity 0.8.17;\n\nimport \"../ITGE.sol\";\nimport \"../IToken.sol\";\n\ninterface ICompaniesRegistry {\n    /**\n    * @notice This is how immutable data about companies is stored\n    * @dev For companies listed for sale, this data is stored in the Registry in mapping(uint256 => CompanyInfo) public companies. Additionally, this data is duplicated in the Pool contract in IRegistry.CompanyInfo public companyInfo.\n    * @param jurisdiction Numeric code for the jurisdiction (region where the company is registered)\n    * @param entityType Numeric code for the type of organization\n    * @param ein Unique registration number (uniqueness is checked within a single jurisdiction)\n    * @param dateOfIncorporation Date of company registration (in the format provided by the jurisdiction)\n    * @param fee Fost of the company in wei ETH\n    */ \n    struct CompanyInfo {\n        uint256 jurisdiction;\n        uint256 entityType;\n        string ein;\n        string dateOfIncorporation;\n        uint256 fee;\n    }\n\n    function lockCompany(\n        uint256 jurisdiction,\n        uint256 entityType\n    ) external returns (CompanyInfo memory);\n\n    function createCompany(\n        CompanyInfo calldata info\n    ) external;\n}\n","keccak256":"0x29470ae054b856a22ea408155e5f8a970a3c0ddf239e907c5793f4e992adf54a","license":"MIT"},"contracts/interfaces/registry/IRecordsRegistry.sol":{"content":"// SPDX-License-Identifier: MIT\n\npragma solidity 0.8.17;\n\ninterface IRecordsRegistry {\n    /**\n     * @notice In the section of the Registry contract that contains records of the type of deployed user contract, the following numeric encoding of contract types is used.\n     * @dev TGE is both a type of user contract and an event for which the contract was deployed.\n     **/\n    enum ContractType {\n        None,\n        Pool,\n        GovernanceToken,\n        PreferenceToken,\n        TGE\n    }\n    /**\n     * @notice Encoding of the registered event type\n     */\n    enum EventType {\n        None,\n        Transfer,\n        TGE,\n        GovernanceSettings\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice This structure is used for contracts storing in the CompanyDAO ecosystem.\n     * @dev The Registry contract stores data about deployed user contracts in `ContractInfo[] public contractRecords`, where records receive a sequential and pool-independent numbering.\n     * @param addr Deployed contract address\n     * @param contractType Digital code of contract type\n     * @param description Contract description\n     */\n    struct ContractInfo {\n        address addr;\n        ContractType contractType;\n        string description;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @notice Using this data, you can refer to the contract of a specific pool to get more detailed information about the proposal.\n     * @dev The Registry contract stores data about proposals launched by users in `ProposalInfo[] public proposalRecords`, where records receive a sequential and pool-independent numbering.\n     * @param pool Pool contract in which the proposal was launched\n     * @param proposalId Internal proposal identifier for the pool\n     * @param description Proposal description\n     */\n    struct ProposalInfo {\n        address pool;\n        uint256 proposalId;\n        string description;\n    }\n\n    /**\n     * @dev The Registry contract stores data about all events that have taken place in `Event[] public events`, where records receive a sequential and pool-independent numbering.\n     * @param eventType Code of event type\n     * @param pool Address of the pool to which this event relates\n     * @param eventContract Address of the event contract, if the event type implies the deployment of a separate contract\n     * @param proposalId Internal proposal identifier for the pool, the execution of which led to the launch of this event\n     * @param metaHash Hash identifier of the private description stored on the backend\n     */\n    struct Event {\n        EventType eventType;\n        address pool;\n        address eventContract;\n        uint256 proposalId;\n        string metaHash;\n    }\n\n    function addContractRecord(\n        address addr,\n        ContractType contractType,\n        string memory description\n    ) external returns (uint256 index);\n\n    function addProposalRecord(\n        address pool,\n        uint256 proposalId\n    ) external returns (uint256 index);\n\n    function addEventRecord(\n        address pool,\n        EventType eventType,\n        address eventContract,\n        uint256 proposalId,\n        string calldata metaHash\n    ) external returns (uint256 index);\n\n    function typeOf(address addr) external view returns devdoc.details: It is a supporting part of the protocol that takes user input arguments and constructs OZ Governor-compatible structures describing the transactions to be executed upon successful voting on the proposal. It does not store user input, but only passes it on in a transformed format to the specified pool contract.

constructor.details: This contract uses OpenZeppelin upgrades and has no need for a constructor function. The constructor is replaced with an initializer function. This method disables the initializer feature of the OpenZeppelin upgrades plugin, preventing the initializer methods from being misused.

getRoleAdmin(bytes32).details: Returns the admin role that controls `role`. See {grantRole} and {revokeRole}. To change a role's admin, use {_setRoleAdmin}.

getRoleMember(bytes32,uint256).details: Returns one of the accounts that have `role`. `index` must be a value between 0 and {getRoleMemberCount}, non-inclusive. Role bearers are not sorted in any particular way, and their ordering may change at any point. WARNING: When using {getRoleMember} and {getRoleMemberCount}, make sure you perform all queries on the same block. See the following https://forum.openzeppelin.com/t/iterating-over-elements-on-enumerableset-in-openzeppelin-contracts/2296[forum post] for more information.

getRoleMemberCount(bytes32).details: Returns the number of accounts that have `role`. Can be used together with {getRoleMember} to enumerate all bearers of a role.

grantRole(bytes32,address).details: Grants `role` to `account`. If `account` had not been already granted `role`, emits a {RoleGranted} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleGranted} event.

initialize().details: This method replaces the constructor for upgradeable contracts.

proposeCustomTx(address,address[],uint25.details: This tool can be useful for creating a transaction with arbitrary parameters and putting it to a vote for execution on behalf of the pool.

params.pool: The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched.

returns.proposalId: The ID of the created proposal.

proposeGovernanceSettings(address,(uint2.details: The main parameter should be a structure of type NewGovernanceSettings, which includes the Governance Threshold, Decision Threshold, Proposal Threshold, and execution delay lists for proposals.

params.pool: The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched and for which the Governance settings will be changed.

returns.proposalId: The ID of the created proposal.

proposeGovernanceSettingsWithRoles(addre.details: The main parameter should be a structure of type NewGovernanceSettings, which includes the Governance Threshold, Decision Threshold, Proposal Threshold, execution delay lists for proposals, as well as two sets of addresses: one for the new list of secretaries and another for the new list of executors.

params.executor: Add a new address to the pool's executor list.
params.metaHash: Hash value of the proposal metadata.
params.pool: The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched and for which the Governance settings will be changed.
params.secretary: Add a new address to the pool's secretary list.

returns.proposalId: The ID of the created proposal.

proposeTGE(address,address,(uint256,uint.details: Proposal to launch a new token generation event (TGE). It can only be created if the maximum supply threshold value for an existing token has not been reached or if a new token is being created, in which case a new token contract will be deployed simultaneously with the TGE contract.

params.pool: The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched and for which the TGE event will be launched.

returns.proposalId: The ID of the created proposal.

proposeTGEERC1155(address,address,uint25.details: Proposal to launch a new token generation event (TGE) for ERC1155 preference tokens.

returns.proposalId: The ID of the created proposal.

proposeTransfer(address,address,address[.details: This function prepares a proposal from the list of recipients and corresponding amounts and submits it to the pool for a vote to transfer those amounts to the specified recipients. The asset type is specified as a separate argument, which is the same for all recipients.

params.asset: Asset to transfer (address(0) for ETH transfers).
params.pool: The address of the pool on behalf of which this proposal will be launched and from whose balance the values will be transferred.

returns.proposalId: The ID of the created proposal.

renounceRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from the calling account. Roles are often managed via {grantRole} and {revokeRole}: this function's purpose is to provide a mechanism for accounts to lose their privileges if they are compromised (such as when a trusted device is misplaced). If the calling account had been revoked `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must be `account`. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

revokeRole(bytes32,address).details: Revokes `role` from `account`. If `account` had been granted `role`, emits a {RoleRevoked} event. Requirements: - the caller must have ``role``'s admin role. May emit a {RoleRevoked} event.

setService(address).details: Stores a new address of the Service contract in the memory of this contract.

params.service_: The new address of the Service contract.

service.details: The address of the Service contract.

devdoc.title: Custom Proposal Contract

proposeGovernanceSettings(address,(uint2.notice: Proposal to replace Governance settings. One of the two methods to change voting parameters.

proposeGovernanceSettingsWithRoles(addre.notice: Proposal to replace Governance settings and change the pool's list of secretaries and executors. One of the two methods to change voting parameters. The only way for a DAO to modify the lists of secretaries and executors.

proposeTGE(address,address,(uint256,uint.notice: This proposal is launched when there is a need to issue additional tokens (both Governance and Preference) for an existing pool. In other words, the issuance of tokens for any DAO is possible only through the creation of such a proposal.

proposeTGEERC1155(address,address,uint25.notice: This proposal is launched when there is a need to issue ERC1155 Preference tokens, additional collections, and token units in existing collections for an existing ERC1155 token. In other words, the issuance of tokens of this format for any DAO is possible only through the creation of such a proposal.

proposeTransfer(address,address,address[.notice: This proposal is the only way to withdraw funds from the pool account.

userdoc.notice: This contract is designed for constructing proposals from user input. The methods generate calldata from the input arguments and pass it to the specified pool as a proposal.
